response_text: Yes — there are real-time audio-to-text translation tools that listen to spoken language, convert it to text instantly, and often translate that text into another language right away. These are used for meetings, conversations, lectures, live events, etc. speechlogger.com+2wordly.ai+2 [https://speechlogger.com/]  Examples / types of tools:  Live speech-to-text + translation apps/web tools  Services that transcribe what you say into text as you speak and can translate into other languages immediately — e.g., Speechlogger for live captioning, Wordly for multi-language meeting captions, Maestra for live transcription + translation. speechlogger.com+2wordly.ai+2 [https://speechlogger.com/]  Mobile apps for instant speech-to-text on phones (Android’s Live Transcribe, Notta, V2T) that show text as you speak. Android+1 [https://www.android.com/accessibility/live-transcribe/]  Communication/meeting solutions  Tools like JotMe or Wordly plug into online meetings (Zoom/Teams) to provide real-time transcript + translated captions. jotme.io+1 [https://www.jotme.io/]  Browser extensions  Extensions like ViiTor or Speech Translator convert audio from videos/meetings to live text and can translate it on the fly. Chrome Web Store [https://chromewebstore.google.com/detail/viitor-translate-ai-trans/debflmkfmkejgppfabgfcbemelmnpnho?hl=zh-CN]  APIs/Platform features  Developer APIs such as Google Cloud Speech-to-Text (can be built into apps to do real-time transcription) or services that deliver live captions. Google Cloud [https://cloud.google.com/speech-to-text?hl=zh-CN]  Note: Some tools do only transcription (speech → text in the same language), while others add translation (speech → text in another language) in real time. Otter.ai [https://otter.ai/]  If you want recommendations for a specific device or platform (phone, browser, meetings, headphones, etc.), tell me and I’ll list options tailored for that.
